channel.title: Linq on Haney Codes .NET - Sharing my experiences as a developer and engineering manager.

item.title: LINQ and Deferred Execution
item.description: As of .NET 3.0, LINQ (and the often related Lambda Expressions) have been available for our use and abuse. LINQ stands for Language INtegrated Query, and is a method of modelling OO data in a more or less relational sense that is not unlike databases. And just like databases, it comes with a cost. To offset this cost, LINQ uses Deferred Execution. Deferred Execution means that the code is not executed until it is needed.
